page.title: 05TAN Y GARTH HALL,PONTFADOG.
page.content: Tan y Garth Hall,Pontfadog was built in 1915-1917 by Dayang Muda of Sarawak wife of Bertram Brooke,Tuan Muda of Sarawak .Who was related to James Brooke (White Rajah of Sarawak) 1803 -1868. The Hall was built of local stone and local oak after the style of William Morris . Outstanding features are the strong construction of the walls and the shape of the veranda . In the garden there are fine examples of Topiary in the shape of birds and also a dovecote .The Hall was built as a family home . Uses later include a school for evacuated children during the Second World War. It is now owned by the International Hermeneutic Society and used as a meditation and study centre.
